Give an asymptotic formula for $\mathrm{ex}(n;C_4)$.



Erd\H{o}s and Klein \cite{Er38} proved $\mathrm{ex}(n;C_4)\asymp n^{3/2}$. Reiman \cite{Re58} proved\[\frac{1}{2\sqrt{2}}\leq \lim \frac{\mathrm{ex}(n;C_4)}{n^{3/2}}\leq \frac{1}{2}.\]Erd\H{o}s and R\'{e}nyi, and independently Brown, gave a construction that proved if $n=q^2+q+1$, where $q$ is a prime power, then\[\mathrm{ex}(n;C_4)\geq\frac{1}{2}q(q+1)^2.\]Coupled with the upper bound of Reiman this implies that $\mathrm{ex}(n;C_4)\sim\frac{1}{2}n^{3/2}$ for all large $n$. F\"{u}redi \cite{Fu83} proved that if $q>13$ then\[\mathrm{ex}(n;C_4)=\frac{1}{2}q(q+1)^2.\]In \cite{Er93} Erd\H{o}s makes the stronger conjecture that, for all $n$,\[\mathrm{ex}(n;C_4)=\frac{n^{3/2}}{2}+\frac{n}{4}+O(n^{1/2}),\]although he said he 'never found any convincing evidence for [this] and would really be satisfied with\[\mathrm{ex}(n;C_4)=\frac{n^{3/2}}{2}+O(n).'\]Erd\H{o}s \cite{Er75} proved\[\mathrm{ex}(n;C_4)\leq \frac{n^{3/2}}{2}+\frac{n}{4}+O(n^{1/2}).\]Erd\H{o}s's stronger conjecture was wrong - Ma and Yang \cite{MaYa23} proved that, for some absolute constant $c>0$ and for a positive density set of $n$, in fact\[\mathrm{ex}(n;C_4)\leq \frac{n^{3/2}}{2}+\left(\frac{1}{4}-c\right)n.\]See also [572].

In \cite{Er75} Erd\H{o}s remarks that he first proved $\mathrm{ex}(n;C_4)\ll n^{3/2}$ while considering the number theoretic problem [425] in 1936, which predates Tur\'{a}n's study of extremal numbers by 5 years. As Erd\H{o}s wrote: 'Being struck by a curious blindness and lack of imagination, I did not at that time extend the problem from $C_4$ to other graphs and thus missed founding an interesting and fruitful new branch of graph theory.'




References


[Er38] P. Erd\H{o}s, On sequences of integers no one of which divides the product of two others and on related problems. Tomsk. Gos. Univ. Ucen Zap. (1938), 74-82.

[Er75] Erd\H{o}s, P., Some recent progress on extremal problems in graph theory. Congr. Numer. (1975), 3-14.

[Er93] Erd\H{o}s, Paul, Some of my favorite solved and unsolved problems in graph
theory. Quaestiones Math. (1993), 333-350.

[Fu83] F\"{u}redi, Z., Graphs without quadrilaterals. J. Combin. Theory Ser. B (1983), 187-190.

[MaYa23] Ma, Jie and Yang, Tianchi, Upper bounds on the extremal number of the 4-cycle. Bull. Lond. Math. Soc. (2023), 1655--1667.

[Re58] Reiman, I., \"{U}ber ein Problem von K. Zarankiewicz. Acta Math. Acad. Sci. Hungar. (1958), 269-273.
